title: Calories in Meatballs and Spaghetti
meta_description: Discover calories in meatballs and spaghetti for a standard serving, including macros, protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard serving: 1 cup cooked spaghetti (140 g), 4 medium beef meatballs (100 g total), 1/2 cup tomato sauce; homemade, no added cheese.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by meat type, sauce ingredients, portion size, and cooking method. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: A standard serving of meatballs and spaghetti has about 520 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant versions.

tweaks.label: Use turkey meatballs instead of beef
Whole wheat spaghetti instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a serving of meatballs and spaghetti?
faqs.a: About 520 kcal for 1 cup pasta with 4 meatballs and sauce.

faqs.q: What's the protein in meatballs and spaghetti?
faqs.a: Roughly 25 g protein per standard serving, mostly from the meatballs.

faqs.q: Are carbs high in spaghetti and meatballs?
faqs.a: Yes, around 60 g carbs per serving, primarily from the pasta.

faqs.q: How does sauce affect calories in meatballs and spaghetti?
faqs.a: Tomato sauce adds about 50-100 kcal; creamy sauces increase it more.

faqs.q: Can I lower calories in meatballs and spaghetti?
faqs.a: Yes, opt for lean meat, veggie meatballs, or smaller portions to reduce by 100+ kcal.
